title: Work - ropes pulling boxes at 37 and 53 degrees

content.description: Two identical boxes, Box <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Box <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, are each pulled across the floor by a rope. As shown in the figure, the ropes pulling boxes <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> are at angles of <math alttext="37 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mn>37</mn><mo>°</mo></math> and <math alttext="53 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mn>53</mn><mo>°</mo></math> from the horizontal, respectively. The tension in each rope is equal to the weight of one box. After each box is pulled horizontally the same distance, the work done on boxes <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> by each rope is <math alttext="W sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="W sub 2" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>W</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </math>, respectively.
content.question: What is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction with numerator W sub 2, and denominator W sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mfrac> <msub> <mi>W</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <msub> <mi>W</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mfrac> </mstyle> </math>?
